title: R44392
content: The Health Coverage Tax Credit (HCTC) covers 72.5% of the premium for eligible taxpayers, who are responsible for the remaining 27.5%. It can only be used for qualified health insurance and is refundable and advanceable. Taxpayers must meet specific eligibility criteria to claim the HCTC. The HCTC is refundable and advanceable, allowing taxpayers to claim the full credit amount even with little or no federal income tax liability. Eligibility is based on specific criteria, with two main groups qualifying for the credit: recipients of certain benefits under the Trade Adjustment Assistance program and individuals aged 55-64 receiving payments from the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation.
